titleStmt.title: W. S. Rogers et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9787

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky.

We the subscribers state that we were of the jury at the last Term of the Bourbon Co Circuit Court, who tried Hugh Kennedy on the charge of arson in committed by burning the barn of Oscar H Burbridge. On said trial we found him guilty of said charge and appli fixed his punishment at two years Confinement in the penitentiary.
The evidence in the case was very conflicting and contradictory in the case. and we in view of all the facts of case petition Your Excellency to pardon said Kennedy.

W. S. Rogers
J, L, Becraft
W. H. Parker
Ja. M. Meng
Daniel Shawhan Jr
Milton Beall
Jno B Neal
James McMiller
F P Clay
